text: Perry Miller Adato (1921 - September 16, 2018) was an American documentary movie producer and director and writer. She was born in Yonkers, New York. Adato won an Emmy Award in 1968 for her first movie, Dylan Thomas: The World I Breathe. She was also known for her movies Gertrude Stein: When This You See, Remember Me in 1970. In 1980 she won an Emmy nomination for Picasso-A Painter's Diary. Adato died on September 16, 2018 in Westport, Connecticut at the age of 97.Perry Miller Adato, a Filmmaker Focused on Artists, Dies at 97 ==References== ==Other websites== * Category:American Emmy Award winners Category:1921 births Category:2018 deaths Category:Movie directors from New York (state) Category:Movie producers from New York (state) Category:Screenwriters from New York (state) Category:People from Yonkers, New York
